body:
indeed as per https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/7ddfc047933a7172de5d62aa08b1ba8fd9c8d81c/src/_pytest/tmpdir.py#L170-L195 they are disjoint

this is a honest oversight, however we have to be careful about correctly remediating

I suggest we fix this ASAP for 4.2 while `tmp_path` has seen little use (I only suspect this, not a hard fact). 

I also don't see a graceful way of fixing this in steps as well, without introducing new options which we will then need to carry on forever...

issue.title: Fix 4680 - `tmp_path` and `tmpdir` now share the same temporary directory

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.title: Replace tmpdir fixture with tmp_path in tests

repository.name: aiohttp
repository.description: Asynchronous HTTP client/server framework for asyncio and Python

issue.body:
I always stumble on `py.path` methods.
A new `pytest` supports `tmp_path` fixture https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/tmpdir.html#the-tmp-path-factory-fixture to work with `pathlib.Path`.

The issue is easy and waits for a champion.
